output: {"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What law applies to the credit information disclosed by the National Housing Bank?", "answer": "Nothing contained in Section 44 shall apply to the credit information disclosed under the Credit Information Companies (Regulation) Act, 2005 (Section 43(3)).", "citations": ["Page 60", "chunk:29/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the maximum interest rate NBFCs can offer on deposits?", "answer": "NBFCs cannot exceed a 12.5% interest rate on deposits.", "citations": ["Page 63", "chunk:29/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the requirements for Simple, Transparent, and Comparable (STC) criteria in securitization?", "answer": "Homogenous, non-default assets with sufficient information history on asset performance and payment details, consistency in underwriting, and transparent enforcement rights.", "citations": ["Page 35", "chunk:15/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Who has the right to relinquish their office before the expiry of the term specified under sub-section (1)?", "answer": "The Managing Director, as the case may be.", "citations": ["Page 16", "chunk:8/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "How can the Presiding Officer be removed from office?", "answer": "The Presiding Officer can only be removed by an order made by the Central Government on the ground of proved misbehaviour or incapacity after an enquiry made by a Judge of a High Court.", "citations": ["36P", "chunk:26/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the procedure for the investigation of misbehaviour or incapacity of the Presiding Officers of the Appellate Tribunals?", "answer": "The procedure for the investigation of misbehaviour or incapacity of the Presiding Officers of the Appellate Tribunals under sub-section (3) of section 36P is to be provided by rules made by the Board.", "citations": ["61(d)", "chunk:35/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What risk management considerations are relevant to these guidelines?", "answer": "The guidelines related to building safety and disaster management implicitly address risks. Further information is needed for a complete assessment.", "citations": ["12", "chunk:14/17"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Are there restrictions on employing individuals whose remuneration includes commission or profit sharing?", "answer": "Prohibited per the BR Act.", "citations": ["Page 25", "chunk:10/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What framework should be used for providing adequate headroom at origination for absorbing rising interest rates on personal loans?", "answer": "A proper conduct framework including feasible options for switching to fixed-rate loans, foreclosure, transparent disclosure of charges, and proper communication to borrowers.", "citations": ["Page 70", "chunk:33/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "How is counterparty credit risk capital computed?", "answer": "Through the Current Exposure Method (CEM): Exposure = Replacement Cost (RC) + Potential Future Exposure (PFE), where PFE is calculated using notional principal amounts and relevant add-on factors.", "citations": ["Page 19", "chunk:7/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What information relating to a housing finance institution is considered confidential and shall not be disclosed?", "answer": "Any information relating to a housing finance institution which is contained in any statement or return submitted by such institution under the provisions of this Chapter or obtained through audit or inspection or otherwise by the National Housing Bank or the Reserve Bank, as the case may be, shall be treated as confidential and shall not, except otherwise provided in this section, be disclosed.", "citations": ["Page 44, Section 35A(1)", "chunk:21/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/Master_Circular_Housing_finance_for_UCBS.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the requirements for the release of movable/immovable property documents upon loan repayment?", "answer": "The document mentions circulars (DoR.MCS.REC.38/01.01.001/2023-24 and DoR.MCS.REC.28/01.01.001/2023-24, both dated 13.09.2023) addressing this, but the specifics are not provided in this excerpt.", "citations": ["Page 16", "chunk:3/3"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Who are the permitted transferors and transferees for non-default loans?", "answer": "SCBs (including SFBs, excluding RRBs), AIFIs, NBFCs including HFCs.", "citations": ["Page 36", "chunk:16/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What powers does the National Housing Bank have to collect information from housing finance institutions as to deposits?", "answer": "The National Housing Bank may direct that every housing finance institution accepting deposits shall furnish to the National Housing Bank and the Reserve Bank in such form, at such intervals and within such time, such statements, information or particulars relating to or connected with deposits received by such housing finance institution, as may be specified by the National Housing Bank by general or special order.", "citations": ["Page 38, Section 31", "chunk:18/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What happens to the costs, charges, and expenses incurred by the recovery officer?", "answer": "Any costs, charges, expenses which in the opinion of the recovery officer have been properly incurred by him as incidental thereto, shall be recoverable from the borrower and the money which is received by it shall, in the absence of any contract to the contrary, be held by it in trust to be applied firstly, in payment of such costs, charges and expenses and secondly, in discharge of debt, due to the approved institution, and the residue of the money so received shall be paid to the person entitled thereto.", "citations": ["Page 51, Line 38", "chunk:25/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the risk weight for domestic sovereign exposures (direct claims)?", "answer": "0%", "citations": ["Page 49, Section IV.8.c.1", "chunk:22/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the penalty for a director, manager, secretary or other officer of a company if an offence under this Act has been committed with their consent or connivance?", "answer": "They shall also be deemed to be guilty of that offence and shall be liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.", "citations": ["/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf#page=64", "chunk:32/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the eligibility criteria for promoters/promoter groups of cooperative banks?", "answer": "Fit and Proper Criteria. Resident individuals with >10 years of experience in senior banking/finance roles; sound credentials and integrity; successful track record >10 years (for individuals). Resident Indian citizens with >10 years of experience in senior banking/finance roles; companies/societies with successful track record >5 years (for companies/societies).", "citations": ["Page 10", "Page 11", "chunk:3/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the LTV ratio and RW guidelines for individual housing loans above ₹ 30 lakh and up to ₹ 75 lakh?", "answer": "LTV < 80%: RW = 35%; LTV > 80%: RW = 50%", "citations": ["Page 10, Section 3(a)", "chunk:10/17"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the rule regarding customer information secrecy?", "answer": "REs must maintain secrecy regarding customer information, disclosing it only in exceptional cases.", "citations": ["Page 73", "chunk:34/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the functions of National Housing Bank as per the Act?", "answer": "The National Housing Bank can formulate schemes for mobilization of resources and extension of credit for housing, economically weaker sections, organizing training programs, providing guidelines to housing finance institutions, technical and administrative assistance, coordinating with other financial institutions, exercising powers and functions in the performance of duties under this Act or any other law, acting as agent of the Central Government, State Government or Reserve Bank, doing all matters incidental to or consequential upon the exercise of its powers or discharge of its duties under this Act, and any other kind of business authorized by the Central Government on the recommendation of the Reserve Bank.", "citations": ["Page 20", "chunk:10/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the composition of an Appellate Tribunal?", "answer": "An Appellate Tribunal shall consist of one person only (hereinafter referred to as the Presiding Officer of the Appellate Tribunal).", "citations": ["Page 52, Line 31", "chunk:25/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the provisioning for restructured NBFC project loans (effective January 24, 2014) if the DCCO is extended beyond two years and up to four years?", "answer": "5.00% from the restructuring date until the revised DCCO or 2 years from the restructuring date, whichever is later", "citations": ["Page 32", "chunk:13/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the minimum holding period (MHP) requirements for non-default loans?", "answer": "3 months for loans with original maturity less than two years; 6 months for loans with original maturity more than two years.", "citations": ["Page 36", "chunk:16/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the basis for classifying revolving facilities as SMA?", "answer": "Outstanding balance continuously exceeds the sanctioned limit or drawing power (whichever is lower) for a specified period.", "citations": ["Page 28", "chunk:12/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Are StCBs/DCCBs allowed to lend to the CRE sector (except CRE-RH)?", "answer": "No", "citations": ["Page 51, Sl. No. 23", "chunk:23/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What law governs foreign exchange for National Housing Bank?", "answer": "The Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999.", "citations": ["Page 22", "chunk:10/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the mortgage-related clauses in the act?", "answer": "Not specified in this document.", "citations": ["P1-P4", "chunk:1/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the rules on fair lending practices, specifically regarding penal charges in loan accounts?", "answer": "Fair lending practices and regulations concerning penal charges in loan accounts.", "citations": ["DoR.MCS.REC.28/01.01.001/2023-24 18.08.2023", "chunk:15/17"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the name by which the National Housing Bank can sue and be sued?", "answer": "National Housing Bank", "citations": ["/Page 12, Line 3", "chunk:6/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the minimum Tier 1 CRAR requirement for SCBs (excluding SFBs, PBs, LABs, RRBs) under Basel III?", "answer": "7%", "citations": ["Page 47", "chunk:21/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Are investors from FATF non-compliant jurisdictions permitted to acquire significant influence in NBFCs/HFCs?", "answer": "No, they are not permitted.", "citations": ["Page 16", "chunk:6/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the enforceable obligation for employees of the National Housing Bank regarding secrecy?", "answer": "They must not communicate or allow to be communicated any information relating to the affairs of the National Housing Bank nor will they allow any such person to inspect or have access to any books or documents belonging to or in the possession of the National Housing Bank and relating to the business of the said National Housing Bank.", "citations": ["Page 74", "chunk:37/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the time limit for filing an appeal to the Appellate Tribunal?", "answer": "The appeal must be filed within 45 days from the date of receiving a copy of the order, but the Appellate Tribunal may entertain an appeal after the expiry of this period if there is sufficient cause.", "citations": ["36S", "chunk:26/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the RBI's authority regarding directors of Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs)?", "answer": "RBI can remove the directors of NBFCs (except government-owned NBFCs) and supersede their board of directors (except the board of Government Company).", "citations": ["Page 14", "chunk:5/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Who has the authority to create special funds or reserves for the National Housing Bank?", "answer": "The Board, if directed by the Central Government.", "citations": ["37(2)", "chunk:28/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "When must details of the recovery agent be disclosed?", "answer": "Upfront at loan sanction and when the loan is passed to the recovery agent.", "citations": ["Page 70", "chunk:33/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "If a resolution plan is not successfully implemented within 365 days from the occurrence of default, what is the total provisioning required?", "answer": "35%", "citations": ["Page 34", "chunk:14/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What happens if there are defects in the appointment of directors or committees of the National Housing Bank?", "answer": "No act or proceeding of the Board or any committee of the National Housing Bank shall be questioned on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or defect in the constitution of, the Board or the committee. No act done by any person acting in good faith as a director or member of a committee shall become invalid merely on the ground that he was qualified to be a director or that there was any other defect in his appointment (Section 45).", "citations": ["Page 60", "chunk:29/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the risk weight for consumer credit (including personal loans) for UCB/DCCB/StCB?", "answer": "125%", "citations": ["Page 52, Sl. No. 24", "chunk:23/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the disqualifications for becoming a director of the National Housing Bank?", "answer": "Disqualifications are outlined in Section 8.", "citations": ["S. 8", "chunk:2/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Who shall follow such directions as the Chairman may give in the discharge of powers and functions?", "answer": "The Managing Director", "citations": ["/Page 14, Line 4", "chunk:6/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Who is liable for an offence committed by a company?", "answer": "Every person who was in charge of, and responsible to the company for the conduct of the business of the company at the time the offence was committed.", "citations": ["/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf#page=64", "chunk:32/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the obligation of banks when introducing new housing loan products?", "answer": "Consider customer suitability and appropriateness; ensure products are suitable for the customer.", "citations": ["Page 11, Section 4(e)", "chunk:11/17"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the effect of any nomination in respect of any deposit, bonds, or other securities with the National Housing Bank?", "answer": "The amount due on such deposits, bonds, or securities shall, on the death of the depositor or holder thereof, vest in, and be payable to, the nominee subject to any right, title, or interest of any other person to such deposits, bonds, or securities. (Section 47A)", "citations": ["/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf#page=62", "chunk:30/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What NNPA thresholds allow dividend declarations for UCBs, SCBs, and NBFCs?", "answer": "UCBs: <5%, SCBs: <7%, NBFCs: <6% (each of the last 3 years, including the financial year for which the dividend is proposed).", "citations": ["Page 54", "chunk:24/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "How long should transaction records and identification records be maintained?", "answer": "Transaction records for at least 5 years from the transaction date; identification records for at least 5 years after the business relationship ends.", "citations": ["Page 72", "chunk:33/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the punishment for contravening provisions of section 29A?", "answer": "If any person contravenes the provisions of sub-section (1) of section 29A, he shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than one year but which may extend to five years and with fine which shall not be less than one lakh rupees but may extend to five lakh rupees.", "citations": ["Page 63, Section 48(2A)", "chunk:31/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the risk weight for consumer credit (excluding housing, education, vehicle, gold, and microfinance loans)?", "answer": "125%", "citations": ["Page 50, Sl. No. 8", "chunk:23/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the timeline for conveying lender consent or objection to borrowal account transfers?", "answer": "Lenders must convey consent or objection within 21 days of receiving a request.", "citations": ["Page 68", "chunk:31/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the name of the act?", "answer": "The National Housing Bank Act, 1987", "citations": ["P1", "chunk:1/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What powers does the recovery officer have if the borrower refuses or fails to comply with an order?", "answer": "The recovery officer may take possession of any property pledged, mortgaged, hypothecated or assigned to the approved institution as security for any assistance in respect of which default has been made and transfer by way of sale, lease or otherwise such property.", "citations": ["Page 50, Line 42", "chunk:25/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the Board's responsibilities regarding outsourcing?", "answer": "Approve a risk and materiality evaluation framework; Set approval authorities; Review outsourcing strategies regularly.", "citations": ["Page 44", "chunk:19/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the final decision-making authority in case of an appeal against rejection or cancellation of certificate of registration?", "answer": "The final decision in such cases lies with the Central Government where an appeal has been preferred to it, or of the Reserve Bank where no appeal has been preferred.", "citations": ["Page 32, lines 6-8", "chunk:15/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Are there restrictions on advances against a bank's own shares?", "answer": "Prohibited per the Banking Regulation Act (BR Act).", "citations": ["Page 25", "chunk:10/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the penalties for a borrower who refuses or fails to comply with an order within the specified time?", "answer": "Where the borrower refuses or fails to comply with the order within the time specified, the recovery officer may take possession of any property pledged, mortgaged, hypothecated or assigned to the approved institution as security for any assistance in respect of which default has been made and transfer by way of sale, lease or otherwise such property.", "citations": ["Page 50, Section 36G(1)", "chunk:24/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the aggregate limit for lending against shares/debentures?", "answer": "20% of Tier-I capital as of March 31st of the previous financial year.", "citations": ["Page 26, Section 9", "chunk:11/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the minimum retention requirements (MRR) for securitized loans?", "answer": "5% for loans with maturity of 24 months or less; 10% for loans with maturity of more than 24 months and loans with bullet repayments.", "citations": ["Page 35", "chunk:15/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the lending limits against securities for Scheduled Commercial Banks for bonds and debentures?", "answer": "Up to ₹20 lakh, with the LTV ratio determined by the bank's internal policy.", "citations": ["Page 20", "chunk:7/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What was the risk weight on housing loans and consumer credit in the mid-term review of the 2004-05 Annual Policy Statement?", "answer": "DBOD.BP.BC.61/21.01.002/2004-05 (23.12.2004) includes the mid-term review of the Annual Policy Statement for 2004-05, covering risk weights.", "citations": ["26", "chunk:16/17"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What investment disclosures are required for NBFCs?", "answer": "Composition of investment portfolio along with details of movement in provisions held towards depreciation", "citations": ["Page 56", "chunk:26/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What controls should REs retain regarding service providers?", "answer": "Controls to implement appropriate measures, including options to transfer service to alternative providers or back to in-house infrastructure.", "citations": ["Page 45", "chunk:20/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What charges should banks exclude when determining the value of a house property for housing loan purposes?", "answer": "Stamp duty, registration, and other documentation charges should not be included in the cost of the housing property.", "citations": ["Page 10, Section 3(b)", "chunk:10/17"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the requirement regarding the separation of roles for Chairman and CEO/MD in banks?", "answer": "Roles of Chairman and CEO/MD are separated in PvSBs (2007) and PSBs excluding SBI (2014), requiring the Chairman to be part-time (non-executive).", "citations": ["Page 14", "chunk:5/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the procedure for the liquidation of the National Housing Bank?", "answer": "No provision of law relating to the winding up of companies shall apply to the National Housing Bank and the National Housing Bank shall not be placed in liquidation save by order of the Central Government and in such manner as it may direct.", "citations": ["Page 70", "chunk:34/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the limits on unsecured loans and advances for individual borrowers?", "answer": "Limits range from ₹25,000 to ₹5 lakh, depending on Demand and Time Liabilities (DTL) and CRAR compliance.", "citations": ["Page 26, Section 8", "chunk:11/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Who can act in place of the Chairman or Managing Director if they are absent?", "answer": "The Central Government may appoint another person to act in his place during his absence.", "citations": ["Page 17", "chunk:8/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is defined under the National Housing Bank Act?", "answer": "Definitions are provided in Sections 2-2.", "citations": ["S. 2-2", "chunk:2/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Who shall exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the National Housing Bank in the discharge of its functions?", "answer": "The Chairman or the Managing Director as applicable", "citations": ["/Page 14, Line 5", "chunk:6/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/Master_Circular_Housing_finance_for_UCBS.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What collateral security measures may UCBs take for construction loans?", "answer": "UCBs may take available collateral.  As construction progresses, contractor payments should reduce loan balances.  Tripartite agreements with borrowers and clients are encouraged when collateral is unavailable.", "citations": ["7.5", "chunk:2/3"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the timeframe for classifying an asset as a Substandard Asset for SCBs/AIFIs, UCBs, and NBFCs?", "answer": "SCBs/AIFIs and UCBs: ≤ 12 months; NBFCs: ≤ 12 months (except NBFC-BL, which is ≤ 18 months).", "citations": ["Page 29", "chunk:12/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the penalties for not adhering to the declaration made by employees of the National Housing Bank?", "answer": "The penalties for not adhering to the declaration are not explicitly stated in the provided document.", "citations": ["Page 74", "chunk:37/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the maximum penalty for failing to comply with a direction given or order made by the National Housing Bank or the Reserve Bank under Chapter V?", "answer": "A penalty not exceeding ten lakh rupees or twice the amount involved in such contravention or default, where the amount is quantifiable.", "citations": ["Page 67", "chunk:33/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the maximum penalty a person or housing finance institution can be imposed for any other provision of this Act being contravened or if any default is made in complying with any other requirement?", "answer": "A penalty not exceeding one lakh rupees in respect of each contravention or default.", "citations": ["Page 68", "chunk:33/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "How did Basel III revise the definition of capital?", "answer": "It raised the minimum Tier 1 capital from 4% to 6% and introduced a CET1 ratio of 4.5%.", "citations": ["Page 17", "chunk:6/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the exemption from registration for the National Housing Bank?", "answer": "There is an exemption from registration for the National Housing Bank. (Section 18A)", "citations": ["18A", "chunk:3/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What shareholder approval is required for a draft amalgamation scheme of banking companies?", "answer": "A resolution passed by 2/3rd of shareholders by value.", "citations": ["Page 74", "chunk:35/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the dividend payout ratios for commercial banks (excluding RRBs) based on CRAR and Net NPA ratio?", "answer": "Ranges vary based on CRAR and Net NPA ratio, with higher CRAR and lower NPA allowing for higher payout ratios (Page 55).", "citations": ["Page 55", "chunk:25/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "Which activities should not be outsourced by an RE?", "answer": "Core management functions, including Internal Audit, Compliance, and decision-making functions like KYC compliance for deposit accounts, loan sanctions, and investment portfolio management.", "citations": ["Page 44", "chunk:20/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the risk that depositors should be aware of?", "answer": "Not specified in this document.", "citations": ["P1-P4", "chunk:1/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "When is Enhanced Due Diligence required?", "answer": "For Non-Financial Businesses and Professions (NF2F) customer onboarding, politically exposed persons, and client accounts opened by professional intermediaries.", "citations": ["Page 72", "chunk:34/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the aggregate exposure limit for UCBs to residential mortgages (excluding priority sector loans)?", "answer": "25% of total loans and advances.", "citations": ["Page 25", "chunk:10/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the manner in which nomination can be made under section 47A(1) of the National Housing Bank Act?", "answer": "The manner in which nomination may be made under sub-section (1) of section 47A is prescribed.", "citations": ["/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf#page=72, line 1", "chunk:36/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What derivative disclosures are required for NBFC-ML and NBFC-UL?", "answer": "Forward Rate Agreement/Interest Rate Swap, Exchange traded Interest Rate Derivatives, and disclosures on risk exposure (qualitative and quantitative) are applicable for NBFC-ML and NBFC-UL.", "citations": ["Page 59", "chunk:27/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the provisioning requirement for commercial banks' project accounts if the DCCO is extended beyond two years and up to four years (infrastructure) or one year and up to two years (non-infrastructure)?", "answer": "5.00% from the restructuring date until the revised DCCO or 2 years from the restructuring date, whichever is later", "citations": ["Page 32", "chunk:13/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "How are off-balance sheet exposures converted to credit-equivalent amounts?", "answer": "Using specified Credit Conversion Factors (CCFs) given for REs.", "citations": ["Page 52", "chunk:24/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the provisioning requirements for UCBs for infrastructure project loans until two years from the original DCCO?", "answer": "0.40%", "citations": ["Page 32", "chunk:14/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What governs the amalgamation of NBFCs?", "answer": "Sections 232 to 234 of the Companies Act, 2013.", "citations": ["Page 74", "chunk:34/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the requirements for a company to commence or carry on the business of a housing finance institution?", "answer": "A housing finance institution which is a company shall obtain a certificate of registration issued under this Chapter and have the net owned fund of at least 25 lakh rupees (Section 29A).", "citations": ["Page 28", "chunk:13/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What additional disclosures are required for NBFC-ML and NBFC-UL?", "answer": "Provisions and contingencies, drawdowns from reserves, concentration of deposits/advances/exposures/NPAs, movement of NPAs, overseas assets, and off-balance sheet SPVs are applicable for NBFC-ML and NBFC-UL.", "citations": ["Page 60", "chunk:27/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the rules regarding foreclosure charges or pre-payment penalties?", "answer": "Foreclosure charges/pre-payment penalties are prohibited on floating-rate term loans for non-business purposes.  HFCs cannot charge pre-payment penalties on floating-rate housing loans pre-closed from any source or fixed-rate housing loans pre-closed by the borrower from their own source.", "citations": ["Page 69", "chunk:32/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the power of the Board to delegate its powers and duties?", "answer": "The Board may, by general or special order, delegate to an officer or officers of the National Housing Bank, subject to such conditions and limitations, if any, as may be specified in the order, such of its powers and duties under this Act as it may deem necessary (Section 43A).", "citations": ["Page 59", "chunk:29/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the timeline for uploading KYC records to CKYCR?", "answer": "Within 10 days of commencing an account-based relationship.", "citations": ["Page 73", "chunk:34/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the maximum penalty for failing to produce any book, account, or other document under this Act?", "answer": "A penalty not exceeding one lakh fifty thousand rupees in respect of each contravention or default.", "citations": ["Page 67", "chunk:33/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What happens if a housing finance institution fails to comply with any condition subject to which the certificate of registration was issued?", "answer": "The Reserve Bank may cancel the certificate of registration (Page 30).", "citations": ["Page 30", "chunk:14/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the short title, extent, and commencement of the National Housing Bank Act?", "answer": "The short title of the act is not specified. The extent and commencement are as stated in Section 1.", "citations": ["S. 1", "chunk:2/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the risk weight for other consumer credit exposure?", "answer": "100%", "citations": ["Page 50, Sl. No. 8", "chunk:23/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is considered as 'net owned fund' for a housing finance institution?", "answer": "Net owned fund means the aggregate of the paid-up equity capital and free reserves as disclosed in the latest balance sheet, after deducting accumulated balance of loss, deferred revenue expenditure, and other intangible assets. It is further reduced by investments in shares of subsidiaries, companies in the same group, all other housing finance companies, book value of debentures, bonds, outstanding loans and advances made to or deposits with subsidiaries and companies in the same group.", "citations": ["Page 32, lines 10-21", "chunk:15/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the capital requirements for NBFC-TL entities?", "answer": "Subject to higher capital charges to be communicated separately upon classification.", "citations": ["Page 48, Section IV.8.b.4", "chunk:22/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "How must banks, NBFCs, and HFCs communicate loan terms and conditions?", "answer": "The credit limit and terms and conditions must be communicated; the borrower's acceptance (after negotiation) must be recorded.  NBFCs and HFCs should use the vernacular language or a language understood by the borrower; late repayment penalties must be in bold in the loan agreement.", "citations": ["Page 67", "chunk:31/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the eligibility criteria for promoters/promoter groups of commercial banks?", "answer": "Fit and Proper Criteria.  Focus on educational background, professional competence, means and standing, ability to mobilize capital, and membership.", "citations": ["Page 10", "chunk:3/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the punishment for failing to comply with an order made by the National Company Law Tribunal under sub-section (2) of section 36A?", "answer": "Whoever fails to comply with any order made by the National Company Law Tribunal under sub-section (2) of section 36A, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to a fine of not less than rupees fifty for every day during which such non-compliance continues.", "citations": ["Page 63, Section 48(2C)", "chunk:31/37"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/handbook.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What are the provisioning requirements for UCBs for infrastructure project loans during the third and fourth years after the original DCCO?", "answer": "1.00%", "citations": ["Page 32", "chunk:14/35"]}]}

{"metadata": {"source_path": "/Users/harshwardhansaindane/projects/tcs/data/NHB-Act-amended-upto-2023.pdf", "doc_type": "regulatory", "language": "en", "notes": ""}, "qna": [{"question": "What is the timeline for disposing of an application made to the recovery officer?", "answer": "The application made to the recovery officer under section 36E shall be dealt with by him as expeditiously as possible and endeavour shall be made by him to dispose of the application finally within six months from the date of receipt of the application.", "citations": ["Page 50, Section 36F(6)", "chunk:24/37"]}]}
